Description:
Downsize, First Home Or Weekend Getaway - The Choice Is Yours...
Private Inspections - By Appointment Only
Nestled in one of Torquays most established pockets, this private, low maintenance, renovated home ticks all the boxes!
Located within a short stroll to both Whites Beach and Fishermans Beach tucked into the quite Grange Crescent, awaits your new leafy abode.
Upon entering the secure and discrete gate via one of its two courtyards is this two bedroom brick property on its own title, with multiple RC units, a gas log fire and a sun drenched north facing dining area making for comfortable living & entertaining all year round!
With local bus stops just around the corner, beach access moments away, Loch Ard Drive shops a short walk up the road - convenience and easy living come straight to mind.
With low maintenance gardens, energy efficient and cost saving solar panels, a secure single car garage - there will be nothing left to do except move in, sit back and enjoy the pristine beaches of Torquay and surrounds, a luxurious relaxed new life is waiting for you.
Internal area
74m²
Insights: 2/29 Grange Crescent, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 13 other 2 bedroom unit in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
SPACIOUS LIFESTYLE OPPORTUNITY !!
If its lifestyle, space and location that is needed in a property, look no further as this amazing 4 bedroom family home will surely impress those searching for a striking looking property with amazing outlook and surrounds. Positioned on over an acre (approx. 4284m2.) on arguably the best allotment, in the very sought after Frog Hollow Estate, Torquay. With a flexible floor plan, generous indoor/ outdoor living spaces, the property is immaculate in presentation placing the new owner in the enviable position of taking possession with nothing to do.
The home comprises four generous sized bedrooms, master bedroom with en-suite and walk in robe, large separate living with formal dining, spacious open plan family, kitchen and meals area with lovely outlook over the rear yard and under cover alfresco area, kitchen complete with stone bench tops, quality stainless steel appliances and an abundance of cupboard space, central main bathroom, separate toilet, laundry and internal access to a remote controlled 4 car garage. Add to this a gas heated swim/spa with complete privacy, to relax and enjoy all year round.
Other features include: ducted heating/ cooling throughout, 3 kilowatt solar power, solar hot water, tinted safety glass windows, rear double gate access, additional shedding and tandem carport, 7,000 litre water tank, outstanding low maintenance well manicured gardens and surrounds, neighbouring reserve with boardwalk, close to parks, schools and a short drive to the beach and town centre.
This definitely is Coastal living at its best.
Insights: 17 Frog Hollow Drive, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 139 other 4 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
To Organise Your Inspection Today - Call Jack on 0488 017 646
Calling all renovators! Potential-plus home walking distance to the beach.
Get out your tools and give this classic beach cottage a modern makeover and add significant value while you're at it, or investors seize the opportunity to redevelop this generous 643sqm block (STCA). Four bedrooms in the main house join a separate bungalow. You'll also love this peaceful Old Barwon Heads location that's ideally set walking distance to local shops and cafes, Barwon Heads Primary School, and the beach.
-- Living area features split-system a/c and a slow combustion wood fireplace
-- Separate dining/meals areas with adjoining galley kitchen
-- Large separate rumpus/games room provides additional living space
-- Main bathroom features a frameless glass shower, bath
-- Four good-sized bedrooms; one with wall-to-wall built-in robe
-- Private bungalow with walk-in robe and ensuite
-- Single garage/workshop with storage space; large leafy backyard
Enter via the enclosed front verandah and into the wide reception hall with all four generous bedrooms located off the hall at the front of the home.
Continue through to the air-conditioned living room with adjoining dining and meals area, and the kitchen with electric cooking awaits your modern touch.
The main bathroom with frameless glass shower, bath and separate toilet, and a well-equipped internal laundry is off the large rumpus/games room at rear.
An air-conditioned bungalow with an independent entry through the garage is perfect for the older teen, independent houseguest, or renovate into a lucrative holiday rental walking distance to the beach.
Upon settlement of this property, Pavilion Property are offering complimentary disinfection misting service by Flick Pest Control https://www.flick.com.au/disinfection-service/
Insights: 32 Thorn Street, Barwon Heads VIC 3227 was last sold in 2020 and 35 other 4 bedroom house in Barwon Heads have recently been sold.

Description:
Chilled Coastal Charmer
Highlighting lines, angles and sunny spots to sit is this recently renovated property in the seaside village of Barwon Heads. As a bonus, it also offers a funky self-contained one bedroom unit for tapping into and reaping the rewards of holiday makers.
Inside the main residence are timber floorboards that flow throughout to allow for easy day-to-day coastal conduct. From the entrance is a living space that opens onto a east-facing deck, adjacent is a double bedroom with built-in robes.
Further along are two more bedrooms with built-in robes, one with an extra nook that is ideal for a teen or kid play spot. Opposite the slumber zone is a shared bathroom with a soaker tub, generous walk-in shower and separate powder room.
The brand new kitchen boasts a stone benchtop, Bosch wall oven, induction stove top, ample soft-close cabinetry, dishwasher and simplifying life with the clothes washing machine in place as well. Neighbouring this is the spacious and light-filled dining and second lounge.
Outside there are several areas for unwinding from the front to the back, plus a garden shed, back fence lined with olive trees, established lawn, striking tree for swinging a hammock and single lock-up garage with a work bench.
Nestle down on a quiet street with a high fence for additional privacy and security. This is the perfect lock and leave weekender, low maintenance investment or entry into the market that is close to the hub of town, beaches, river, schools, parks, sporting facilities, childcare and road into Geelong.
Insights: 6 Cottesloe Drive, Barwon Heads VIC 3227 was last sold in 2007 and 35 other 4 bedroom house in Barwon Heads have recently been sold.

Description:
Affordable living in sort after location.
Nestled in a tightly held and highly sought after leafy pocket of Belmont is this immaculate unit. Complimented by a modern contemporary upmarket finish, it demonstrates a wonderful utilisation of space and features quality kitchen and bathroom, open living, large bedroom with BIRs, separate laundry, undercover car space with lockable storage and both front & rear private courtyards.
The property also offers dishwasher and heating. If you are an investor looking to add to your portfolio this is the opportunity you have been waiting for, with an exceptional tenant on lease until October 2020 at $285 per week. Enviably located a stone's throw from the Highton Village Cafe & Shopping Precinct with ample public transport available, an inspection will be sure to delight!
Insights: 2/7 Sanglen Terrace, Belmont VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 5 other 1 bedroom unit in Belmont have recently been sold.

Description:
The search is over.
Situated on 1091sqm (approx.) in a quiet court and in a very sought after pocket of established Highton, you will be impressed by the scope and flexibility the floor plan this unique family home provides. Complete with four bedrooms, three bathrooms, three car garage, additional driveway/second cross over for car or boat accommodation, multiple living areas and a self-sufficient unit which proves to be a valuable and rare asset. Architecturally designed and positioned with seamless access to public transport and school bus routes, Geelong CBD, Ring Road for commuters, the Barwon River, plus the Highton Village and all your daily amenities it has to offer.
The self-contained one-bedroom unit provides countless possibilities its next owner. It has been a residence for many Airbnb guests, accommodation for extended family, but also could be a great teenage retreat or scope to further expand. Throughout the property, you are accompanied with multiple living/family areas which allows for flexible family living. The main living area has direct access to the elevated deck, the dining room has a gorgeous gas log fireplace. The spacious kitchen contains an abundance of storage and cupboard space, wall oven, gas stove and dishwasher. Upstairs you will find the parents retreat, fulfilled with study nook, walk in robe and ensuite.
Features throughout include updated central bathroom, new carpets, matt finish timber floorboards, tinted north facing windows, plantation shutters, gas ducted heating, large capacity water tank with pumps for the garden, new pump to rear water tank and a separate workshop space.
The search is over.
Insights: 7 Marlyn Court, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 108 other 4 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
The Complete Family Entertainer
Enrich your standard of living quality and lifestyle with this Malishev-built showpiece, which flaunts a sophisticated sense of style in a desirable location.
Enjoying the benefits of space and an intelligent low-maintenance design, this superbly styled lifestyle haven speaks family with its three separate living areas and seamless indoor-outdoor entertaining. The homes strong contemporary appeal immediately reveals itself in the form of a generously proportioned formal lounge and dining area, while beautiful tiled floors, stunning high ceilings and fully equipped kitchen with quality appliances and a walk-in pantry enhance the modern flavour of the radiant open-plan living domain. A magnificent alfresco area with open fire place and water feature allows you to entertain in style year round or unwind amongst established gardens on a large sun stoked 665m2 approx allotment. The essence of relaxation extends to the superb master bedroom, which boasts its own retreat, large walk-in robe and luxurious ensuite. An additional three robed bedrooms are also zoned in privacy towards the rear and serviced by a central bathroom, while a study / home office offers a peaceful space for the home office worker.
Adding further appeal, this instant lifestyle upgrade or stylish investment also boasts a large laundry, oversized DLUG, gas ducted heating, evaporative cooling, garden watering system and swift access to Waurn Ponds shopping village, Deakin University, Epworth hospital, ring road and the Surf Coast.
Insights: 96 Fogarty Avenue, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 108 other 4 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
TIME TO ESCAPE YOUR COASTAL LIFESTYLE IS WAITING!!
Time to escape city living for a coastal lifestyle. This low maintenance three-bedroom home presents the perfect opportunity and is ideally located within walking distance to amenities including, shops, public transport, parks, the beach and boasts water views. Built over two levels, entry level offers a spacious rumpus room that opens onto a decked undercover entertaining area, two spacious bedrooms with built in robes, family bathroom with floor to ceiling tiles, laundry and an abundance of storage options. The upper level incorporates a light filled open plan living, dining and kitchen with a private decked balcony previewing brilliant water views providing a peaceful place to enjoy a morning cuppa or entertain family and friends. Powder room and master bedroom with extensive built in robes and en-suite complete this level.
Property features includes high ceilings, engineered bamboo flooring timber floor-boards and staircase, ducted heating, split system cooling, Miele dishwasher, granite bench tops, ceiling fans, double lock up garage with internal and rear access, water tank, parking for the caravan, boat or trailer all set on low maintenance landscaped gardens. This is the perfect residence for those looking for a coastal family or holiday home, investment property in a great location with no work to be done, call today for more information.
Insights: 138A Fischer Street, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 126 other 3 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
CLASSIC WITH OCEAN VIEWS
Set at the top of a quiet court in the ever popular Ocean View estate, this elevated double storey home built by one of Torquays most recognised family builders has plenty to offer.
Possessing the unique blend of panoramic ocean views, multiple living zones and restful outdoor spaces, making this home a great retirement option, enjoyable holiday retreat or fantastic investment proposition. Relaxation and entertainment being two of the main focuses, highlighted by the enclosed viewing deck capturing sea views, a rear conservatory ideal for all year round entertaining, decked outdoor gazebo and inground spa, all combine to make any stay an unforgettable experience.
Other features of the home include: 3 bedrooms master with ensuite and Wir, roomy kitchen/dining/family, separate living room, family bathroom, European laundry, spacious parents retreat, cosy gas log fire, reverse cycle heating and cooling, loads of storage, double lock up garage and much more.
The property has the added bonus of a services easement at the rear with gated access and a family park just around the corner, allowing all ages the pleasure of added space. This unbeatable position is a short walk to the RACV golf club resort, the thriving Bells Street shops, restaurants/cafes and lastly but most importantly, world renowned beaches.
So, if you desire a property that has all the trappings of a fantastic coastal lifestyle environment, this will be the property for you dont delay your inspection.

Description:
Privacy Abounds With Luxury Lifestyle
The Feel:
This distinctive 4BR family home with dual living areas is designed to embrace the very essence of coastal living. Stunning cedar exteriors complement linear board cladding & Spotted Gum decking, while inside a fresh colour palette & natural timber elements offer a calm aesthetic. Bespoke cabinetry, polished concrete floors, high ceilings & zoned sleeping quarters combine to provide functional zoning for family life, with sunny outdoor spaces that embrace the north & east aspects.
The Facts:
-Low maintenance 2-storey, 4BR home, in private rear position
-Open plan living, kitchen, dining with north & east outlook to deck, lawn & garden
-Main living & dining zone has sliding doors directly onto the Spotted Gum deck
-Light-filled space with high ceilings, matte-finish polished concrete floors & fresh white palette
-Kitchen, laundry & powder room boast 60mm stone bench tops integrated with semi gloss cupboards
-Smeg wall oven, s/s apps & ample storage including floor to ceiling Blackbutt pantry doors
-Subway tiles feature in the kitchen, while marble tiles elevate the bathrooms & laundry
-Recycled Messmate timber stairs with glass balustrade; LED sensor lights to the handrail
-Louvre windows throughout invite desirable east-west natural ventilation
-Family-friendly layout with kids retreat upstairs; 3 bedrooms with BIRs, bathroom & living area
-Master retreat downstairs w/ stunning dressing area & luxury en suite (double vanity, in situ shower)
-Convenient powder rooms on both floors
-Attractive study nook with floating timber desk & purpose-built cabinetry
-Bathrooms feature bespoke Vic Ash units, floor to ceiling tiles & designer tapware
-Zoned gas ducted heating & evaporative cooling + double glazed windows = 6.1 energy rating
-Mature 4m+ Pittosporum boundary plantings & low maintenance lawn
-Grass pavers underneath driveway lead to exposed aggregate concrete car parking
-Cedar clad double RC garage w/ internal home access & door to rear yard
-Other notable features include: outdoor hot/cold shower, 3k ltr water tank plumbed to toilets, LED lighting & roller blinds throughout, laundry chute, garden shed
-Just minutes to school, shops, river & beach via Village Parklands
Owner Loves.
We love the contemporary design & timber features of this home. It has a spacious floor plan that has been very practical for our family. We enjoy the private aspect & the low maintenance of the well established trees."

Description:
Location and convenience.
Presenting the perfect first home or ideal addition to your investment portfolio, this contemporary two bedroom unit offers low maintenance living without compromising on space. You will find yourself only moments from the Highton Village, just a short walk to the Porter Ave shops and seamless access to the Ring Road. A perfect little abode that is situated with the best amenities and public transport at your doorstep. Updated impeccably throughout, this property impresses with a functional light filled floor plan, ample storage space and a terrific kitchen with plenty of bench space and updated appliances. Additional features include a single car garage, generous yard space that is sizeable to privately entertain family and friends all year round.
This property represents an exciting opportunity to get a foothold in the popular Highton suburb, ideally positioned with excellent access to Waurn Ponds shopping centre, aquatic centre, library, Deakin University and the Epworth Hospital. Be sure to enquire today.

Description:
Classy built home, perfect for your portfolio
Consisting of 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a sizable open plan living, this is the perfect first home or investment. This low maintenance build has everything thought of for you, all you need to do is move in! This homely floor plan has a balance of classic style & functionality. It's proximity to Geelong CBD, the Surfcoast and Marshall train station is perfect for your everyday convenience!
INVESTORS- Currently tenanted until 31st October 2020 at $1,782 per calendar month
Kitchen- laminate benchtops with overhang perfect for breakfast bar, neutral tile splashback, double sink, 600mm stainless steel gas cooktop, oven & range hood, built in pantry
Living- open plan adjoining living, dining & kitchen, carpeted living area, timber laminate flooring through dining & kitchen, ducted heating throughout, roller blinds, glass sliding doors open from living to backyard
Master bedroom- carpeted, window roller blinds, ducted heating, walk in robe, ensuite with semi frameless shower, single vanity, frosted windows with shutter blinds for privacy
and personal toilet
Additional three bedrooms- carpeted, roller blinds, ducted heating, sliding robes
Main bathroom- semi frameless shower, long bath, single vanity, frosted windows with shutter blinds for privacy and separate toilet
Outdoor- longer driveway, large low maintenance front yard, sun exposed cement backyard alfresco, fruitful back garden
Mod cons- ducted heating throughout, four generous sized bedrooms, secluded laundry accessed through kitchen with linen press, trough and external access, double lock up garage with internal access, laminate flooring & roller blinds.
Ideal for: investors, young families and first home buyers
Close by local facilities: Marshall train station, Grovedale College, Primary School & Kindergarten

Description:
A rare opportunity!
This charming Weatherboard home built in the early 50s on a generous 661m2 block is an ideal renovation project or development (STCA). Located close to Belmont shopping strip and public transport it features 2 good sized bedrooms, bathroom, neat lounge and kitchen. With character features like decorative cornices, mantle and Baltic pine under carpet this really is a rare opportunity to buy a property in a fantastic part of town with heaps of potential. The layout has a bedroom to the right as you enter the home and the bathroom. To the left is the lounge. Moving down the hall the second bedroom is to the right and the kitchen to the left. The Laundry is located through the back door and to the right. Beyond this is a large rear yard with an expense of grass and fruit trees. The positioning of the house on the block lends itself to development. While the garage would need to be removed it has the requisite 3 metres between the home and the fence line. In such a sought after part of Geelong this really is a rare opportunity to develop for capital growth. Definitely worth a closer look!

Description:
Set to Tick All of Your Boxes
This much-loved home has been tastefully updated and will be a delight from the moment you walk through the front door. Located in the heart of Leopold this is a great opportunity to secure a beautiful family home in a prime location.
This quality brick veneer home is situated on a corner allotment of 656m2 approx. With plenty on offer this home includes three generous sized bedrooms, two separate living zones, two bathrooms and ample car accommodation. The master bedroom is located at the front of the home for peace and privacy. A walk-in robe provides ample storage, while the tastefully renovated ensuite features a large shower, single vanity, and toilet. The two additional bedrooms offer built-in robes and utilise the main central bathroom and separate toilet. Take your pick of two separate living zones, you can enjoy the open plan kitchen & living space to relax and entertain, while the more formal lounge & dining zone is large enough for all the family and friends to gather on those special occasions. The updated kitchen compromises nothing but quality. With beautiful stone bench tops, Bosch Pyrolytic oven, induction cook top & dishwasher, all while overlooking the lovely front courtyard for you to enjoy.
Outdoors offers an oversized double garage with room for shelving, storage and internal access to the home. The outdoor undercover entertaining area is perfect for entertaining on those summer nights. As an added bonus this property has a second crossover and secure side access perfect for extra car, caravan or boat storage. All this is complimented by immaculately manicured gardens, just waiting for you to move in.
Added extras include 2x gas wall furnaces, split system cooling, ceiling fans, and updated quality carpet throughout.
This home is an absolute MUST SEE boasting phenomenal presentation and a sensational location, this is move in ready.
Insights: 52 Darrambal Crescent, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020 and 101 other 3 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
As New In The Tightly Held Pocket Of Old Torquay
Age is no limit with a 4 person lift in this architect-designed townhome right in the heart of old Torquay just 500m to the beach. A standout custom built property by local award winning builder adorned with superior fittings and finishes throughout.
What YOU'LL LOVE:
- Residential 4 person lift
- Salt and pepper concrete floors with in floor hydronic heating
- Hydronic heating, split system heating/cooling and ceiling fans throughout
- Timber floor boards to upper level and 100% wool carpets
- Ocean glimpses from upstairs living area
- Double glazed windows with remote automated blinds
- 3.3m high ceilings in main areas and Velux skylight
- Several private outdoor deck areas
- 2pac cabinetry with 60mm marble stone and waterfall edges
- High quality fixtures, fittings and full height joinery throughout
- Security, intercom system, keyless entry and ducted vacuum
- Oversize DLUG with internal access (no step into garage for accessibility)
What The VENDOR LOVES:
The house has beautiful high ceilings and amazing sunshine coming in from all angles throughout the day. The location is incredible - so close to the beach and in such great proximity to walk to the shops, cafes and beaches that Torquay has to offer.
Insights: 1/40 Anderson Street, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 126 other 3 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Location Location and Neat as a Pin!
Perfectly positioned for first home buyers, investors, downsizers or buyer alike, boasting an abundance of natural light this two bedroom unit will tick many boxes.
Enviably set off the Service Road and at the rear of the complex, you will enjoy the privacy as well as the abundance of conveniences at your fingertips.
This exciting opportunity offers a spacious and light drenched living and dining area, 2 bedrooms with built in robes, central bathroom with separate toilet and a nicely updated kitchen which leads out to the private paved entertaining area which rounds out this fantastic low maintenance package!
Additional features include: split system, neutral colour pallet, abundance of natural light, abundance of storage, immaculate condition, single carport and paved entertaining area.
You're close to everything Belmont has to offer, in close proximity to the High Street's shopping strip extending many major amenities, including - but definitely not limited to - cafes, health clinics, shops, restaurants, Public transport at your doorstep, schools for all ages, the Geelong CBD and Surf Coast are very easily accessible.
Opportunities like this don't last, inspect today and secure this amazing opportunity!
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.
Insights: 4/86 Settlement Road, Belmont VIC 3216 was last sold in 2015 and 40 other 2 bedroom house in Belmont have recently been sold.
